page.title: 09INVERKEILOR CHURCH
page.content: The Inverkeilor Church is one of Inverkeilor's main attractions.It was built 119 years ago and has been re_built before,as it is mentioned in charters as long ago as 1178 when Arbroath Abbey was built.It is hard to know who built the Church but it is dedicated to Saint Connon.The oldest part of the Church is known to be the {North Esk}panelling which has an engraved coat of arms.This is also known as "{The Gallery}".The bell's age is not known but it is thought to have been there since the 18th century. One well known minister from the 17th century was{Joshua Durie}.It is probable that he acted as an envoy to King Charles 1,and he is remembered today by his gravestone which has a Latin verse on it.
